posts.name: Butcher and Bee
posts.note: Butcher and Bee is a hip outpost offering a rotating menu of inventive, seasonal cuisine made with local ingredients. From their website, 'We regularly update our menus with seasonal items, so what you see online may be different than what we're serving right now. For today's menu, please give us a call Their baked goods are wholesome nutritious breads, pastries, sweets, and more is handmade on-site daily by our talented and creative baking team..' NOTE: They have another location in Nashville, TN.

posts.name: Callie’s Hot Little Biscuit
posts.note: Callie’s Hot Little Biscuit is a snug counter serve featuring several types of biscuits, plus grab-and-go sandwiches, coffee, and tea. Order the cheddar country ham biscuit which contains butter and cream cheese. For dessert get the peach biscuit.

posts.name: Chubby Fish
posts.note: From the Chubby Fish website, 'A chef-driven seafood concept from Chef James London. We proudly offer fresh, Lowcountry seafood with innovative preparation. Tucked away in Charleston’s Historic Elliotborough neighborhood, Chubby Fish partners with local fishermen and farmers to feature the very best local ingredients. The Chubby Fish menu spotlights fresh catches straight from the waters of Charleston and changes daily.'

posts.name: Fig
posts.note: Fig serves elevated take's on Southern classics with seasonal ingredients served in an upscale-bistro setting.

posts.name: The Glass Onion
posts.note: The Glass Onion is an upbeat spot serving refined, locally sourced soul-food favorites in a charming environment. From their website, 'The Glass Onion is one of Charleston’s original homegrown neighborhood-based, locally focused, all-natural restaurants. Owner and Executive Chef Chris Stewart opened the restaurant in 2008 with fellow culinary colleagues. It was one of the first places in town to support local farmers and purveyors on almost every dish and drink on the menu.'

posts.name: Husk
posts.note: Husk is an ever-changing menu of locally sourced Southern dishes served in a restored Victorian-era home. NOTE: They have multiple locations nationally.

posts.name: McCrady’s
posts.note: McCrady’s is an acclaimed spot for high-concept, locally sourced American food in an intimate, brick-walled setting. McCrady’s is a tasting-menu-only restaurant helmed by James Beard Award-winning Chef Sean Brock. The 22-seat space, located in historic downtown Charleston, features exceptional hospitality and an open kitchen creating an intimate and adventurous dining experience.

posts.name: Nana’s Seafood and Soul
posts.note: Nana’s Seafood and Soul is a colorful nook dishing up down-home grub, such as fried whiting, devil crab, and pork chop sandwiches.

posts.name: Xiao Bao Biscuit
posts.note: Xiao Bao Biscuit is a creative, multicultural Asian cooking, and specialty cocktails in a trendy converted gas station. From their website, 'Select dishes from China, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam prepared locally and inspired by kick-ass grandmothers everywhere. The menu changes seasonally, with rotating daily specials and family-style dinner service.'
